title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4622.13 - Value of merchandise prizes
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4622.13 - Value of merchandise prizes

State Regulations

When any merchandise prize is awarded in games of chance, its value shall be its cost to the licensee or, if donated, its current market
value. The current market value of merchandise prizes donated to the licensee
shall not be reported as an expenditure in the financial statement of games of
chance, bell jar or raffle operations (forms GC-7, GC-7Q and GC-7R), and shall
not be deducted on the cash control report form (GC-7B). No merchandise prize
shall be redeemable or convertible into cash directly or indirectly by the
licensee. No alcoholic beverage shall be offered or given as a prize in any
game of chance. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9

4622.13

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
